author: developeruche
content:
Hey! Want to drop a quick update on this;

1. Lighthouse was modified to to log the time taken to perform `engine_newPaylaod` on an EL, GETH in this case.

2. Spamming/Benchmark scripts for case_one (block depth: 0, 8, 32, 64, witness_size: 100mb, 300mb, 500mb). case_one is engine_newPayload + debugExecutionWithness

3. newPayloadWitness impl on GETH + Lighthouse. also logging how much time is take account for JSON serialization and network latency.

4. Spamming/Benchmark scripts for case_two(witness_size: 100mb, 300mb, 500mb)


This is more that enough to get the needed data but I am having problem building a block having 100mb, 300mb or 500mb witness size, I was of the opinion, a block filled with tx interacting with a smart contract would blot up the witness size but from my test it was just 0.3mb and randomly sampling mainnet blocks I get an average witness size of 8mb witness. want to know if my chain of thought regarding this is completely flaw.


Bench code: https://github.com/developeruche/witness-bench

Sample code aiming to build a block of 300mb witness: https://github.com/developeruche/witness-bench/blob/main/spammer/runners/300mb.ts


Once I can tune a block to output a witness of 100, 300 and 500mb the bench report would be ready. 

Would love to know if anyone have some thoughts on how I should go about that?
